column1: 1605|five past four|I was standing at the top of the long flight
column2: overlooking the red brick buildings that walled the snow-filled quad and preparing to catch the trolley back to the asylum
column3: when a tall young man with a rather ugly and bespectacled
column6:
"Could you please tell me the time?"
I glanced at my watch. "Five past four."

column1: 1605|five minutes past four|IT was exactly five minutes past four as Mr. Robert Audley stepped out upon the platform at Shoreditch
column2: and waited placidly â€¦ it took a long while to make matters agreeable to all claimants
column3: and even the barrister's seraphic indifference to mundane affairs nearly gave way.
